description: To the Editor:

title: Japan Starts to Shop Its Bullet Train Technology
description: TSURU, Japan  The experimental MLX01 maglev is the worlds fastest train. But it is confined to a 12-mile track. And like the train itself, its technology has been trapped in Japan.

title: Decline Is Seen in NASAs Research Side
description: WASHINGTON  The decline of basic research at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration jeopardizes the agencys ability to study and explore the cosmos, a review panel of scientists and engineers said Tuesday.

title: Ohio: Analysis Reopens Kent State Controversy
description: New analysis of a students audio recording from the shootings in which four student were killed at Kent State University in 1970 shows that Ohio National Guard troops received orders to fire into a crowd of unarmed students, according to two audio forensics experts. Six seconds before shots were fired, a National Guard officer is heard giving the command All right, prepare to fire, said Stuart Allen, one of the experts involved. The Cleveland Plain Dealer, which obtained a copy of the tape, asked Mr. Allen and a colleague to review it. The Ohio National Guard declined to comment. Terry Strubbe, the man who made the recording, disagrees with Mr. Allens findings. It was a really bad recording, Mr. Allen said. Its pure mud.

title: The Latest Score: Four Banks Played a Perfect Game
description: It is the Wall Street equivalent of a perfect game of baseball  27 up, 27 down, the final score measured in millions of dollars a day. Despite the running unease in world markets, four giants of American finance managed to make money from trading every single day during the first three months of the year, The New York Timess Eric Dash reports.

title: At the Morgan, Gently Restoring a Treasure-Filled Building
description: When the Morgan Library & Museum reopened four years ago after undergoing a widely praised $106 million renovation and expansion, it seemed as if its problems had ended. Renzo Pianos design, with its gleaming steel-and-glass entrance on Madison Avenue, soaring atrium, new gallery spaces and 280-seat auditorium, provided much needed space. It also gracefully linked the Morgans three disparate buildings and erased its awkward 1991 glass atrium.

title: J. P. Morgan's Library
description: A look inside the building designed by Charles McKim in 1906 to house J. P. Morgans personal office and library. The Morgan Library & Museum is embarking on a $4.5 million project that will gently restore it.

title: Drinking While Viewing
description: The Sazerac played a role in The Curious Case of Benjamin Button. Martinis abounded in the Thin Man movies. The Dude enjoyed his White Russians.

title: Introducing the Really Green Card
description: Its called a green card, but the identification that the authorities issue to lawful permanent residents has been white, pink, blue and beige  almost anything but green. Now it will be green, though that is the least high-tech feature of a redesign announced Tuesday by United States Citizenship and Immigration Services. The new card, which will replace those now in circulation as they are lost or renewed, incorporates holographic images, laser engraved fingerprints and radio frequency identification chips that will allow Customs and Border Protection officers at ports of entry to read the card from a distance.

title: For Chernin, an Empire of His Own
description: LOS ANGELES  Ever since Peter A. Chernin left the News Corporation as Rupert Murdochs second in command, the media world has wondered what he would do next.

title: Four Nerds and a Cry to Arms Against Facebook
description: How angry is the world at Facebook for devouring every morsel of personal information we are willing to feed it?

title: A Derby Victory Is Nice, but at WinStar Farm, Business Is Business
description: They love their horses at WinStar Farm. The owners, Bill Casner and Kenny Troutt, have played at every level of horse racing. The farms top management, Doug Cauthen and Elliott Walden, grew up in the horse business. When Super Saver galloped home first in the Kentucky Derby on May 1, WinStar had reached horse racings mountaintop.

title: Thrills and Traps, Lurking on the Web
description: To the Editor:

title: I.M.F. Plays Deal Maker in Europe
description: ZURICH  The International Monetary Fund is ready to do deals.

title: Filling a Roster Is Easier Than Filling the Net
description: And the United States thought things were gloomy, given that forward Charlie Davies has not recovered sufficiently from a serious car accident to play in the World Cup.

title: Cross at Center of Legal Dispute Disappears
description: LOS ANGELES  A seven-foot-tall Latin cross in the middle of both the Mojave Desert and a Supreme Court case on the separation of church and state has been stolen, federal officials said Tuesday.

title: Egyptian Emergency Law Is Extended for 2 Years
description: CAIRO  After years of the governments promising to end Egypts state of emergency, Parliament on Tuesday approved a government request to extend for two years its right to arrest people without charge, detain prisoners indefinitely, limit freedom of expression and assembly, and maintain a special security court.

title: Rivera Is Still Watching and Waiting
description: DETROIT  One of these days, Mariano Rivera will pitch again. He has not pitched since April 30, a stretch of nine games, and he missed another opportunity Tuesday when the Yankees game against the Tigers was rained out.

title: In Newburgh, Gangs and Violence Reign
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y.  It started with adolescent taunting near a frozen pond on a January afternoon and soon escalated into a brawl.

title: Gyllenhaal and Sarsgaard Work Together Again on Chekhov Play
description: If the Park Slope neighborhood of Brooklyn seems a little less cool next January, it may be because Maggie Gyllenhaal and Peter Sarsgaard, both at right, will simultaneously be out of town, at least for part of each day: the wife-and-husband actors will once again appear together in a production at the Classic Stage Company, that East Village theater company said on Tuesday. This time they will appear in Chekhovs Three Sisters, reuniting Ms. Gyllenhaal and Mr. Sarsgaard with the director Austin Pendleton and their co-star Mamie Gummer from Classic Stage Companys 2009 production of Uncle Vanya. The cast of Three Sisters will also include Ebon Moss-Bachrach and Josh Hamilton. The theater company will begin its season in September with Sarah Ruhls adaptation of Virginia Woolfs Orlando, directed by Rebecca Taichman. Other productions include Double Falsehood, a play that scholars believe includes reworked material by Shakespeare, to be directed by Brian Kulick; and School for Lies, described as a free-form, modern riff on Molires Misanthrope, adapted by David Ives and directed by Walter Bobbie.

title: Gulf Benefit to Feature Kravitz and Toussaint
description: Lenny Kravitz, left, is among the musicians with ties to Louisiana who will participate in a benefit concert to assist residents affected by the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico, The Associated Press reported. Mr. Kravitz, who lives part time in New Orleans, was the first performer to commit to the benefit, called Gulf Aid, which is scheduled for Sunday at the Mardi Gras World River City there. Other artists expected to perform include Allen Toussaint (below), Mos Def, Ani DiFranco, the Voice of the Wetlands Allstars (including Tab Benoit, Dr. John and Cyril Neville) and the Preservation Hall Jazz Band. Tickets are $50 and will be sold through Elevate Tickets. The event, whose proceeds will go to organizations that help Gulf Coast fishermen and the areas seafood industry, as well as those that address environmental issues, will also be broadcast on the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage radio station WWOZ-FM (90.7) and wwoz.org.

title: Texas Officer Is Acquitted in Shooting
description: HOUSTON  A jury on Tuesday acquitted a white police officer accused of shooting a young black man in a case that attracted widespread attention in Texas because the victims family accused the police of racial profiling.

title: Senators Demand Tighter Rules on No-Fly List and Addition to Terror Group List
description: WASHINGTON  After a briefing on the Times Square bombing attempt, the top Democrat and Republican on the Senate Intelligence Committee called Tuesday for improvements in the no-fly list and the addition of the Pakistani Taliban to the governments official list of terrorist organizations.

title: Before a Bridge Slices Through Vineyards, It Divides German Winemakers
description: RZIG, Germany  Compared with Robert Eymael, Markus Berres is a new kid on the block. The vineyards that Mr. Eymaels family works were first documented as early as 1177. Mr. Berress forebears are registered as vineyard owners only since 1510.

title: Phoenix Counts Big Boycott Cost
description: Boycotts threatened or carried out over Arizonas new immigration enforcement law could cost the Phoenix metropolitan area $90 million in hotel and convention business over five years, Mayor Phil Gordon said Tuesday.

title: San Francisco Museum Picks Design Finalists
description: The San Francisco Museum of Modern Art has selected four architectural firms as finalists to design its expansion. The finalists are Adjaye Associates; Diller Scofidio & Renfro; Foster & Partners; and Snohetta. In addition to tripling the museums gallery and public spaces, the expansion will showcase the Doris and Donald Fisher Collection of Modern and contemporary art. The project will also support enhanced exhibitions and educational programs, and improve public amenities. The final choice of architect will be announced in September, and initial design concepts will be unveiled in 2011. The expansion is slated for completion in 2016. In February the museum announced that it had raised more than $250 million toward its projected $480 million campaign goal to finance the expansion and build its endowment.

title: Easy Win for Dancing
description: With its finalists narrowed to Erin Andrews, Evan Lysacek, Niecy Nash, Chad Ochocinco and Nicole Scherzinger, Dancing With the Stars topped the ratings on Monday as 19 million viewers tuned in to the ABC contest, according to Nielsens estimates. The network led the night over all, and its crime series Castle (11.4 million) finished ahead of both CBSs CSI: Miami (11.1 million) and NBCs Law & Order (6.2 million). CBS was the runner-up, drawing its largest audiences for its comedies Two and a Half Men (13.8 million) and The Big Bang Theory (13.6 million). Fox ranked third as 24 (8.5 million) inched closer to its series finale. NBC placed fourth as a new episode of Chuck (5.3 million) hit a ratings low for the series.

title: Margaret Atwood Accepts Israeli Prize
description: Margaret Atwood, below, accepted the Dan David Prize at Tel Aviv University in Israel on Monday, telling an interviewer before the ceremony that to snub the honor would be tantamount to throwing overboard the thousands of writers around the world who are in prison, censored, exiled and murdered for what they have published. Ms. Atwood, the Canadian author of The Year of the Flood and a vice president of International PEN, the literary human rights group, shared the $1 million prize with the Indian writer Amitav Ghosh (Sea of Poppies). Before the awards ceremony, Ms. Atwood had been urged by Palestinian groups and writers from other countries not to accept the prize as a protest of Israels policies toward the Gaza Strip and its artists. But Ms. Atwood was not persuaded, telling Bloomberg News, We dont do cultural boycotts. She added: Artists dont have armies. What they do is nuanced, by which I mean it is about human beings, not about propaganda positions. The Dan David Prize, which its organizers describe as an award for people who have made an outstanding contribution to humanity, in each of the three time dimensions: past, present, and future, has previously been given to Tony Blair, Al Gore, Tom Stoppard, Amos Oz and Yo-Yo Ma.

title: Revamped Microsoft Office Will Be Free on the Web
description: Microsoft has created a chimera in its new Office 2010 software, part desktop software and part Web app.

title: Side by Side, but Divided Over Immigration
description: ALBUQUERQUE  As the Arizona Legislature steamed ahead with the most stringent immigration enforcement bill in the country this year, this states House of Representatives was unanimously passing a resolution recognizing the economic benefits of illegal immigrants.

title: Carol Burnett to Host SNL? Fans Want It
description: Lorne Michaels, youve got no one to blame for this but yourself. You invite Betty White to host Saturday Night Live after hundreds of thousands of Facebook fans clamor for it  yielding a memorable show and strong ratings in the process  and you open the door for copycat campaigns to put other stars of a certain age onto your show. Already off and running is a Facebook page called Carol Burnett to Host SNL (Please?)! that is closely modeled on the site that helped Ms. White land a hosting spot on SNL. Its creator (who posted an image with Ms. Burnett and the SNL logo, above) writes that Ms. Burnett, the sketch comedian, Broadway star and author, would be an outstanding choice to host SNL, adding, Icing on the cake would be a cameo appearance by Tim Conway! As of Tuesday afternoon, more than 32,000 like-minded fans had signed on in agreement. But theres not much influence they can exert right now: the SNL season finale, hosted by Alec Baldwin, is Saturday.

title: La Cage and Fela! Take Shows on the Road
description: The Broadway revival of La Cage aux Folles, which racked up 11 Tony Award nominations last week  including one for best revival of a musical  will hit the road for a national tour starting in the fall of 2011, the shows producers have announced. The revival of Jerry Herman and Harvey Fiersteins musical, which opened April 18 at the Longacre Theater, stars Kelsey Grammer as Georges, Douglas Hodge as Albin and Robin De Jess as Jacob. There is no word yet on the casting for the tour, said Jim Byk, a spokesman for the producers. The producers of Fela!, the story of the Nigerian activist and musician, which also earned 11 Tony nominations, plan to take it abroad and to Chicago; Dallas; Houston; Los Angeles; Minneapolis; Miami; Philadelphia; San Francisco; Tempe, Ariz.; and Washington. Overseas, look for engagements in Amsterdam; Paris; Toronto; Rotterdam, the Netherlands; and Sydney and Melbourne in Australia. Those stops for Fela!, which opened last November at the Eugene ONeill Theater, are in addition to a previously announced special engagement at the National Theater in London this November.

title: Golfers Death Stuns Friends and Family
description: MOBILE, Ala.  The practice range is where the women of the L.P.G.A. Tour gather early in the workweek to exchange gossip and girl talk. It is their water cooler, a usually festive place where beautiful swings compete with buoyant personalities for attention.

title: Kissing Cousins
description: The past comes to us in tantalizing fragments  a bone here, a footprint there. But of all the fragments yet discovered, perhaps none is so tantalizing as the one published in the journal Science last week: the Neanderthal genome.

title: Greeces Newest Odyssey
description: Athens

title: Dallas Braden: Mouth That Roared (Perfectly)
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  The Class A Stockton Ports opened a new ballpark in 2005, but the players still parked at the old one. The day of the first practice, Daric Barton and Richie Robnett, both first-round draft picks, rolled into the old lot and dropped off their cars: a Tahoe for Barton, a Range Rover with 24-inch rims for Robnett.

title: Cameron Faces Challenges Beyond His Coalition
description: LONDON  The Conservative Party that David Cameron inherited in 2005 was a disoriented shadow of its once mighty self, riven by ideological disarray, wounded by endless power struggles and facing the bleak prospect of long-term unelectability.

title: Regulators Dissect Trades, Searching for Cause of Plunge
description: WASHINGTON  Regulators examining the causes of the brief stock market free fall last Thursday are looking closely at heavy selling in the market for stock-index futures by a single trader, beginning 10 minutes before stock prices began to plummet.

title: Where Gang Violence Devours Youths
description: In a small, run-down city on the Hudson, the murder rate is startling, and so is the young age of many of the victims and perpetrators.

title: Rachael Ray and Senator Lobby for School Lunch
description: WASHINGTON  Rachael Rays signature smile evaporated during a car ride to the Capitol on Tuesday. None of her trademark catchphrases  Yum-o or fantabulous  tumbled from her mouth.

title: The Path of the Jaguar
description: Animal conservation groups are working to establish pathways for big cats to travel through human-populated areas. One such corridor is in place for Costa Rica's jaguars.

title: Common Thread in Failed Drug Tests Raises New Questions
description: The drugs tripped up Dodgers outfielder Manny Ramirez a year ago and just last month ensnared a young pitcher named Edinson Volquez. Then, last Friday, the same drugs derailed another athlete when the N.F.L. suspended Houston Texans linebacker Brian Cushing.

title: Disney Movie Unit Drives Strong Results in Quarter
description: LOS ANGELES  The Walt Disney Company appears to be having some success in repairing its movie operation, but now its television business is springing a leak.

title: A New York Bloc on the Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has some justices who are liberals and some who are conservatives. It has some who see themselves as strict constructionists and some who probably do not.

title: The Evil of Lesser Evilism
description: WASHINGTON

title: The Making of a Terrorist
description: One fate the conservative commentator Daniel Pipes doesnt have to worry about is drowning in conceptual complexity. He keeps his theories simple. His theory about why Faisal Shahzad tried to blow up a bomb in Times Square last week is jihadi intent.

title: Lottery Numbers
Cuomo Sues Hedge Fund Over Madoff
description: Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo of New York on Tuesday charged a unit of Bank of New York Mellon and two former executives with fraud, saying they failed to disclose information that pointed to problems at Bernard L. Madoff Investments.

title: Broader Horizons for South Dakota Senator
description: OXON HILL, Md.  Six years ago, he toppled a political giant. So whats next for Senator John Thune?

title: A Canadiens Rookie Emerges as a Stopper
description: PITTSBURGH  The moment was almost vintage Sidney Crosby. He was working the puck along the Montreal Canadiens end boards against the rookie defenseman P. K. Subban. Crosby then carried the puck up the side boards, abruptly changed directions and headed back into the corner and, finally, darted up the boards again.

title: Our Inner Neanderthal
description: If things had gone differently, this editorial might have been written by a Neanderthal contemplating the discovery that a small but significant portion of his or her DNA was derived from ancestral humans, who lost out in the struggle for survival some 30,000 years ago. Things went the other way, and this editorial is being written by a human musing on the recent discovery that 1 percent to 4 percent of our human DNA is derived from Neanderthals.

title: Specter, After Shift, Faces Fire From Both Sides
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa.  One year after leaving the Republican Party in the face of crumbling support, Senator Arlen Specter of Pennsylvania is now fighting to avert rejection  and presumably the end of his career  at the hands of Democrats.

title: In Greek Debt Crisis, Some See Parallels to U.S.
description: Its easy to look at the protesters and the politicians in Greece  and at the other European countries with huge debts  and wonder why they dont get it. They have been enjoying more generous government benefits than they can afford. No mass rally and no bailout fund will change that. Only benefit cuts or tax increases can.

title: Dallas Braden Soaks in His Perfect Moment
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  It was business as usual for Dallas Braden on Tuesday, if a routine workday includes reciting the Top Ten list for David Letterman. Yes, there were some jokes about A-Rod.

title: Without Haney, Where Does Woods Turn?
description: With Hank Haney stepping down as Tiger Woodss personal coach  a gracious move that spared both player and coach weeks of awkwardness as Woods reconfigures his game and moves on to another tutor  the next question becomes who will supplant Haney.

title: To Help Jaguars Survive, Ease Their Commute
description: LAS LOMAS, Costa Rica  Hctor Porras-Valverdo tried to adopt a Zen attitude when he discovered recently that jaguars had turned two of his cows into carcasses.

title: Some Surprises
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Todays puzzle works a little better in the newspaper. Six shaded boxes make more sense of the theme, but since neither Across Lite nor the New York Times Java applet can do shading, electronic solvers get circles instead. It still works. Theres also a difference in the 47 Across clue because Across Lite doesnt handle superscripts either. My geeky XPF initiative is an attempt to reduce these restrictions by extending the digital definition of crosswords in a standard way. Well see how far I get.

title: Mineral Agencys Split Follows Nations Lead
description: When Interior Secretary Ken Salazar said Tuesday that he would insulate safety and environmental enforcement from the revenue-raising side of the agency that regulates offshore drilling in the United States, he was following in the footsteps of several other countries with extensive drilling operations.

title: A Deal for Better Schools
description: When school officials and unions work together, students have a real chance to come out on top. That was clear this week when the State Education Department and New Yorks teachers unions announced agreement on a rigorous teacher evaluation system.

title: Is It Safe to Go Back In?
description: What could be worse than a 20-minute, 1,000-point drop in the stock market? A 20-minute, 1,000-point drop that defies explanation.

title: A Proposal to End Shady Car Dealers
description: The tussling in Washington over financial regulation has focused on the merits and dangers of derivatives, establishing a procedure for the orderly liquidation of failed banks and setting up a new consumer protection agency.

title: Booker Is Re-elected Newark Mayor
description: NEWARK  Declaring a thunderous victory, Cory A. Booker easily won re-election as Newarks mayor on Tuesday, and at least seven of his allies on the nine-member Municipal Council appeared headed to victory.

title: Industry Doesnt Step Up
description: Who is to blame for last months catastrophic oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico? The other guy. At least thats what three oil executives, predictably and cynically, told a Senate hearing on Tuesday.

title: As Clinton Aide, Kagan Recommended Tactical Support for an Abortion Ban
description: WASHINGTON  Elena Kagan, President Obamas nominee to the Supreme Court, once recommended to President Bill Clinton that he support a Democratic-sponsored ban on some late-term abortions as a way to defeat a stronger measure gaining momentum in the Senate.

title: Court Nominee Figures in Midterm Campaigns
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court confirmation hearings for Solicitor General Elena Kagan are weeks away, but her nomination is already becoming a flash point in midterm Congressional campaigns as candidates in both parties try to exploit the coming court fight.

title: Lakers and Suns Sweep Drama Aside
description: Nothing can contain Kobe Bryant or neutralize Steve Nash, except perhaps the Gregorian calendar and the N.B.A. itself.

title: Veteran House Democrat Loses Seat in Primary
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Alan B. Mollohan of West Virginia, a veteran Democrat, on Tuesday became the first House incumbent to lose his seat this year when he was handily defeated in a hard-hitting primary by State Senator Mike Oliverio.

title: Relatives of Kurds Executed in Iran Are Denied the Remains, and 2 Are Arrested
description: The authorities in Iran have refused to allow the families of five Kurdish activists hanged on Sunday to bury them, and have arrested the sister and mother of the only woman among the executed, one of the activists lawyers said Tuesday.

title: A Tough Observer of Climate Prescriptions
description: The latest online column from Richard Black of the BBC demonstrates why hes at the top of the heap among those of us trying to make sense of global climate trends and diplomacy. He deconstructs the merits and drawbacks of the Hartwell Paper, an endeavor by a variegated crew of economists, political scientists and others to chart a reality-based path toward limiting risks from climate extremes while, in the long haul, curbing emissions of greenhouse gases.

title: Corrections
description: NATIONAL

title: Despite Recalls, Toyota Reports $1.2 Billion Profit
description: TOKYO  Despite being mired in recalls and inquiries into its safety record, Toyota roared back to a profit in the fiscal year that just ended and forecast on Tuesday a further increase in earnings.

title: An Indian Chess Grandmaster, the World Champion Since 2007, Retains His Title
description: The chess world has a new king, and he is the same as the old king.

title: Mets Ask for Offense, and a Newcomer Answers
description: During spring training, Mets Manager Jerry Manuel nicknamed Chris Carter the Animal because Carter arrived for work by 7 a.m. and displayed relentless desire.

title: Job Offer for Noted Spanish Judge
description: Spains well-known investigating magistrate, Baltasar Garzn, left, who is being prosecuted in a case filed by far-right Spanish groups, has been offered a temporary post as an external adviser to the prosecutor at the International Criminal Court in The Hague, a court official there said. The judge gained an international reputation as a fearless prosecutor of cases including those on Basque and Islamist terrorism, drug traffickers and the former Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet. Mr. Garzn was indicted last month on charges of abusing his powers. He has denied the charges.

title: Sleeping Under the Stars in Brooklyn
description: As a frequent traveler, Ive spent many, many hours in airports: departing, arriving, eating and enduring layovers. Generally, though, Ive been lucky. Never have I had to spend the entire night in an airport  no snuggling up on hard plastic benches, no sprawling in an unused corner, no erecting a makeshift tent out of blankets, dead-battery iPods and plastic bags.

title: Indian Official to Visit Pakistan
description: In another sign of expanding diplomacy between India and Pakistan, the Indian external affairs minister, S. M. Krishna, will travel to Islamabad, the Pakistani capital, in July to address the trust deficit between the nuclear-armed neighbors. Mr. Krishnas trip is scheduled for July 15. Mr. Krishna will meet his Pakistani counterpart, Shah Mehmood Qureshi, as the two countries try to address a long and contentious list of issues ranging from terrorism to water rights to the contested region of Kashmir.

title: Conservatives for Higher Taxes
description: Change often happens slowly.

title: Chile: Pakistani Still in Custody
description: A Santiago court on Tuesday extended the detention of a Pakistani man arrested Monday after traces of explosive material were found on his belongings as he entered the American Embassy there. Embassy officials initially detained Mohamed Saif ur-Rehman, who is 28 years old, after security-screening equipment detected the explosive residue on papers he was carrying, said Paul E. Simons, the American ambassador to Chile. The man had gone to the embassy to deal with a visa issue, Mr. Simons said.

title: Arlen Specters Advertisement
description: Senator Arlen Specter started running this advertisement on Tuesday. It will be shown in Pennsylvania.

title: An Unusual Housing Opportunity
description: San Francisco will soon have a 154-unit luxury apartment building inside the Presidio, a former military base that is now a 1,500-acre national park.

title: Luxury Rentals Help National Park Pay Its Own Way
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Renters here will soon have an unusual housing option: a 154-unit luxury apartment building inside a national park. For the last 30 years, the property was an abandoned hospital covered in graffiti, where trespassers caroused in operating rooms and shot photos of empty drawers in the morgue.

title: Joe Sestaks Advertisement
description: Representative Joe Sestak started running this advertisement last week.

title: Karzai Visits Washington, With Smiles All Around
description: WASHINGTON  Beneath twinkling chandeliers and amid tables of pastry and crudits, the Obama administration set out Tuesday to charm President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan, rounding up cabinet members and other V.I.P.s to welcome him and his ministers at a State Department reception.

title: South African Youth Leader Is Given a Mild Punishment After a Series of Gaffes
description: JOHANNESBURG  Julius Malema, the inflammatory president of the governing partys youth league, was given a mild punishment by party elders on Tuesday after a disciplinary hearing that many here once expected to yield a far harsher comeuppance.

title: Cleveland Boos James as Celtics Dominate
description: CLEVELAND  If this was goodbye, it lacked any sentiment, affinity or warmth. If LeBron James is destined to leave the Cleveland Cavaliers, he will have departed in a fog of disappointment, to a shocking chorus of boos.

title: Photo Replay: May 11
description: A view of the day in sports, including the opening of the Nascar Hall of Fame in Charlotte, N.C., tennis in Madrid and ice hockey in Germany.

title: At Christies, a $28.6 Million Bid Sets a Record for Johns
description: It was an all-American moment at Christies on Tuesday night. One of Jasper Johnss seminal Flag paintings, from 1960-66, which had belonged to the writer Michael Crichton, became the star in the auction houses postwar and contemporary art auction, selling for $28.6 million.

title: Shifting Fortunes of Cellphones
description: Video may have killed the radio star. But in the cellphone wars, its the computing industry that is destroying the former leaders of the handset sector, namely Nokia and Motorola, whose roots lie in the wireless radio business.

title: Andor Lilienthal, a Chess Grandmaster, Dies at 99
description: Andor Lilienthal, the last of the original 27 chess grandmasters, who played 10 world champions and beat 6 of them, died Saturday at his home in Budapest. He was 99.

title: Outdoor Concert
description: In the sixth installment of Ozier Muhammads series, Sounds From Uncommon Spaces, we meet Chris Washburne, a trombonist and an assistant professor of ethnomusicology at Columbia University. He often practices in Morningside Park. His remarks, to Mr. Muhammad, have been condensed and edited for brevity and clarity.

title: Mets Get to Nationals Clippard
description: 11:43 p.m. | Updated The Mets brought Nationals reliever Tyler Clippard back to earth on Tuesday.

title: Iran: Diplomat Is Attacked
description: Pakistans ambassador to Iran, Mohammad Bakhsh Abbassi, was wounded and taken to a hospital in northern Tehran on Tuesday after a 21-year-old Afghan man assaulted him with a knife, the ISNA student news agency reported, quoting the Foreign Ministry spokesman, Ramin Mehmanparast. Reports about the attack were contradictory and it was unclear how seriously Mr. Abbassi was hurt; the semiofficial news agency Fars said he was at home and in good condition; earlier reports said he was in the hospital. ISNA reported that the assailant was arrested. His motives were unclear.

title: Mother Tosses Child Into River and Then Jumps In, Police Say
description: A 33-year-old Upper West Side woman was charged with attempted murder after she threw her 19-month-old daughter into the Hudson River on Tuesday and then jumped in herself, the authorities said.

title: Super Bowl Bid Exalts New York, and Winter
description: There could be the commissioners party at the American Museum of Natural History and another party with a view of the Statue of Liberty from Liberty State Park. Maybe a breakfast at Tiffany & Company for team owners and their families. Perhaps even a Super Bowl float in the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade.

description: MOSCOW  As the financial markets try to absorb news of a rescue package for Greece and other teetering euro-zone economies, some bankers and economists see parallels to Russias default in 1998.

title: Program to Combat Asthma Would Lean on Landlords
description: For decades, public health experts have tried  and mostly failed  to contain an asthma epidemic that afflicts many New Yorkers living in the citys poorest neighborhoods.

title: Word of the Day | gamely
description: gamely \gam-le\ adverb

title: Fifth Deadly Attack on a School Haunts China
description: BEIJING  Gates and cameras have been installed at schools. Security guards have been trained to fend off knife-wielding attackers. Chinas top security official convened a nationwide conference call, ordering underlings to protect children when they attend classes.

title: A Scenic Village That Knew What It Wanted, and Got It
description: PELHAM MANOR, N.Y.  A decade ago, this suburb in southern Westchester County, where well-kept 1920s Tudor and colonial houses command some of the highest prices in the county, was home to a blighted industrial area bordering the Bronx to the south and Mount Vernon to the west.

title: Mistrial in Brooklyn Hate Crime Case
description: After more than three days of jury deliberations, a holdout juror prompted a mistrial Tuesday night in the hate crime trial of a Brooklyn man accused of beating an Ecuadorean immigrant to death.

title: Robust Economy, Back to Prerecession Levels, Forces Beijing Into a Balancing Act
description: SHANGHAI  Data from China released on Tuesday showed explosive growth in some segments of the countrys economy, renewing concerns that Beijing may have to do more to prevent it from overheating.

title: Serving Up Musical Comfort Food
description: MADISON AVENUE is alive with the sound of The Sound of Music  and other mainstay musicals like Carousel, The King and I, Oklahoma and South Pacific  as more than a dozen marketers use songs by Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein II in commercials.

description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays front page.

description: Terra Firma, the private equity firm that owns EMI, is confident it will meet its debt obligations to Citigroup into next year, forestalling a default by the music company, according to two people with knowledge of the matter.

description: For a quarter century, Florenz Ziegfeld auditioned hundreds of thousands of young women vying to become chorus girls, the Ziegfeld Girls, those lace and chiffon visions of glamour who were as much a part of the Jazz Age as Stutz Bearcats, the Charleston and F. Scott Fitzgerald.

One name that has quickly surfaced is Sean Foley, a golf teacher based in Orlando, Fla., not far from Woodss home.

title: Prokhorov to Take Over Nets
description: As expected, the N.B.A. board of governors approved the Russian billionaire Mikhail D. Prokhorovs deal to be the new majority owner of the Nets. The approval was unanimous among the teams that voted. One team, the Chicago Bulls, did not vote.

description: Crystal Bowersox > Michael Lynche > Casey James > Lee DeWyze

title: Spansion Gets Investment From Silver Lake Sumeru
description: Silver Lake Sumeru, the middle-market investment group of private equity firm Silver Lake, said Tuesday that it invested in the flash memory drive maker Spansion, which just completed a reorganization related to its filing for bankruptcy protection more than a year ago. The size of the investment was not disclosed, The Associated Press said.

title: Bangkok Protest Leaders Appear Divided
description: BANGKOK  Protest leaders appeared deeply divided late Wednesday over whether to end their long occupation of Bangkoks commercial center, in the face of a warning by the government that it might soon use force against them.

description: Ever since Peter A. Chernin left the News Corporation as Rupert Murdochs second in command, the media world has wondered what he would do next.

title: A Martian Moment
description: Update, May 17 | It is now possible to search the Moment in Time interactive gallery by the name given in the photographers credit line (actual name, pseudonym or screen name, as the contributor chose). Youll find the search box in the upper right corner of the opening page. If you believe your picture wasnt posted, we urge you to give this a try.

title: Gold Hits Fresh High as Uncertainty Prevails
description: Gold hit another record high on Wednesday, while Asian stock markets slipped further and the euro remained under pressure  all signs of the intense nervousness that continues to dog the global financial markets despite the massive rescue package to combat the European debt crisis.

title: Google-AdMob Deal Gets Extended Federal Review
description: Google may have gotten some help from its rival Apple in its attempt to acquire the mobile advertising start-up AdMob.

title: Sampler: Audit Criticizes Muni Overtime Pay, and Palin Fallout
description: Audit Finds Considerable Overtime at Muni | Muni could save $3 million annually by reining in overtime, according to an audit by the San Francisco Board of Supervisors budget analyst. Muni experiences a high level of absenteeism among its drivers, making service less reliable, in part because of incentives in the way that they are paid. Now, drivers can work overtime  earning time-and-a-half pay  even if they have not worked 40 hours in a week. That rule creates a financial incentive for drivers to skip work on regular workdays and to work overtime on other days, the audit found. The beleaguered transit agency recently cut service 10 percent. The Transport Workers Unions contract expires on June 30, 2011. [The San Francisco Chronicle]

title: HBO Plans Film of The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
description: Henrietta Lacks, the Baltimore woman who died never knowing that her cancer cells would become the building blocks for countless medical studies and treatments, will live on in a film being developed for HBO. In her book Ms. Skloot chronicles the life of Ms. Lacks, whose cancerous cervix cells were cultured without her permission, and travels with her daughter Deborah from the former slave quarters where Henrietta grew up to the colored ward of the hospital where she received scarring radiation treatments for her cancer. No casting or debut date for the HBO film was announced.

title: Latin Flair
description: Ten years ago, Alex Atalas D.O.M. broke the tradition in So Paulo of culinary colonialism  French, Italian and Japanese were good; Brazilian was bad. Now, after so many bowls of feijoada, a young class of chefs is mixing cuisines and techniques and taking Brazilian cooking to a higher level. Checho Gonzles, 44, the heavily tattooed chef at the year-old restaurant Aj (Rua Bela Cintra, 1709; 011-55-11-3083-4022; entrees $17 to $27), fuses the flavors of his native Bolivia with the classics of Brazilian cooking. (Each of his knuckles is inked with the image of a popular local bar snack.) The meat stew cozido, for example, is made with tender chunks of picanha braised in red wine, and the caipirinhas are flecked with bright red aj peppers from the mountains of his homeland. At Marakuthai, tucked away in a house in Jardins (above; Alameda Itu, 1618; 011-55-11-3062-7556; entrees $20 to $29), the 21-year-old Renata Vanzetto takes inspiration from Thai food for her cooking, which is based on fresh local fruit and produce, for dishes like shrimp in curry sauce with coconut-crusted banana. And at Ka (Avenida Presidente Juscelino Kubitschek, 279; 011-55-11-3045-0043; entrees$22 to $37), a high-design Jardins hot spot, Paulo Barros uses Amazonian ingredients like star fruit and bacuri to localize his French-Italian menu. Brazil is now being looked to as a global economic player, says Barros, 37. So why not bring its power into the kitchen, too?

title: Obama Blasts Auto Dealer Loophole
description: In an unusually forceful foray into Senate floor debate, President Obama on Wednesday issued a statement opposing a proposal by Senator Sam Brownback, Republican of Kansas, to protect auto dealers from new consumer protection provisions in a major financial regulatory bill.

title: My Big Break
description: Tony Award nominees talk about how they got a foot in the stage door.

title: J.F.K. Passenger Detained in Egypt Over Guns in Luggage
description: Customs officers at Cairo International Airport discovered two undeclared 9-millimeter handguns and ammunition in the checked luggage of a passenger who had arrived Tuesday from New York on Egypt Air, officials said.

title: Vintage Finds From Around the World
description: Readers uploaded photos of their favorite vintage clothing and accessories.

title: Lincoln Center Fall Festival to Focus on the Spiritual
description: Seeking transcendence near Lincoln Center? The area is rich in holy places for Roman Catholics, Jews, Mormons, Protestants and Muslims. Or perhaps you could skip them and worship at the altar of art music.

title: Introducing She Owns It: I Didnt Know There Were Women Out There Like Me
description: When I first considered blogging about women who are business owners and entrepreneurs, I wondered whether they really needed to be singled out any more than business owners with green eyes or entrepreneurs whose names begin with the letter M. I was leery of addressing a vast and varied population of women as if they were all the same but somehow different  in a bad way  from their male peers. As a former editor with Fortune Small Business, I was aware that many businesses owned by women did not grow as quickly as those of some of their male counterparts  the result of complex factors that include financing challenges, the lingering effects of centuries of gender discrimination and the vastly different socialization of women and men.

title: Metal Band Godsmack Tops Chart
description: Big holidays often give sales bumps to certain albums, and Mothers Day is no different, often helping performers like Michael Bubl or Neil Diamond reach No. 1.

title: Hurricane Ike Is Out of Preakness
description: The Preakness lost a starter on Wednesday after Hurricane Ike was found to have an injured left hind leg while training at Churchill Downs. He had been scheduled to fly from to Baltimore on Wednesday.

title: Avoiding Tensions, Obama Reassures Karzai
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama promised President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan on Wednesday that the United States would remain in Afghanistan for the long haul, even as he vowed to stick to his timetable to begin withdrawing troops by July 2011.

title: Patient Voices: Thyroid Disease
description: A tiny gland that can cause a host of problems. Six men and women speak about living with thyroid disease.

title: Personal Identity in a War Zone
description: A call to active duty soldiers and officers: Capt. Timothy Hsia is leaving active duty after nearly a year of being the main writer of our A Soldier Writes feature. We thank him for all his insightful posts and wish him the very best. At War would like to experiment with the feature, asking any active duty service member, especially those posted in Afghanistan and Iraq, to send in postings for publication. Below we are printing a piece from Capt. Henry Brewster, who sent in a post about religion and identity in Iraq.

title: Delta Adding Flights from New York to 30 Cities
description: Seeking to bolster its flights out of New York City, Delta Air Lines announced plans to expand service fromthere to nearly 30 cities worldwide, including major business destinations like Chicago, St. Louis, London and Tokyo.

title: In the Seattle Area, an Assortment of Treats
description: EVERY weekend, my husband, children and I trundle off to the red bakery  our unofficial moniker for the Columbia City Bakery, named for its south Seattle neighborhood  and sit down near people in eccentric hats, cyclists, dog walkers and other families with small children who share our scone-and-coffee routine.

title: Answers About the Legacy of Robert Moses
description: Following is the first set of responses from Roberta Brandes Gratz, who is responding to readers questions about her book, The Battle for Gotham: New York in the Shadow of Robert Moses and Jane Jacobs, which looks at New Yorks urban recovery from the 1970s through the lens of the clashing visions of Robert Moses and Jane Jacobs.

title: Q & A: Joerg Koch
description: After reading the summer issue of 032c (which I wrote about in an earlier post), featuring William T. Vollmann and photographs by Danko Steiner, I rooted out my few copies of Nest. I hadnt thought about them in a while and wasnt surprised that their look and sense of freedom continued to inspire. A frustration voiced a lot these days  by art directors, writers, bloggers and others  is that people arent actually creating new things today. They are repeating, mimicking, collecting, downloading, endlessly commenting upon  activities that may be interesting andthat may reflect the present moment but are not about creating anything. One could even argue that they are the opposite of creativity and produce the feeling of being in a prison. Of course, when you consider the very real problems that many people in the world face, like hunger and shortages of medicine, these sorts of complaints sound silly. But creativity in the arts and in applied arts like fashion obviously does matter, and the ways that people insist on being outside the prison are interesting. Perhaps that was the essence of my conversation with Joerg Koch, the editor of 032c, which is based in Berlin. Here are some excerpts:

title: S.T.A.R. Student
description: Footage provided by the University of South Carolina of the 1971 state S.T.A.R. Student Awards.

title: Forget the Afterlife, These Are for Here and Now
description: PYRAMIDS, pharaohs, snakes, hieroglyphics and plenty of golden jewels  yep, King Tut is back in town.

title: Under-Skin Defibrillators Seen Closer to Reality
description: The likelihood that patients in the United States may some day receive heart defibrillators that can operate without electrical wires connected to their hearts has moved a step closer, according to a study published Wednesday.

title: Asked and Answered | T.J. Lavin
description: Dont let the incredibly long name of this show turn you off: The Real World/Road Rules Challenge: Fresh Meat II, airing Wednesdays at 10 p.m., is the perfect union of two long-running MTV series. The challenge provides the naval-gazing (and fabulous real estate) of The Real World with the globe-trotting and physical challenges of Road Rules. Up for grabs is a cash prize of $300,000 for the last team standing.

title: The Costs of Obamacare
description: As long as Im talking about alternative health care bills, its worth lingering over some of the latest news about the bill we actually got. First, the C.B.O. has released a new estimate of how much additional discretionary spending on implementation costs, further subsidies for new and existing programs, etc. health care reform is likely to generate over the first 10 years. The total comes to $115 billion above and beyond the official price tag, a sum that would almost wipe out the bills projected deficit savings in the first decade.

title: Our Crazy Supreme Court Nomination Process
description: Gail Collins: David, your column about Elena Kagan had a wonderful description of Organization Kids who succeed upward, ever upward without ever taking a risk or displaying passion  intellectual or otherwise. That sounds pretty boring, but you also said that youve yet to meet anyone who knows Kagan who isnt an admirer. So lets call her careful. Really, really careful.

title: Penetrating the Process of Obamas Decisions
description: With relentless 24/7 media coverage of President Obama and a floodlet of books about him, the reader might well ask: Why another study of him and his White House, when his presidency is less than a year and a half old? And yet the Newsweek columnist Jonathan Alters book The Promise actually does give us a new perspective on the 44th president by providing a detailed look at his decision-making process on issues like health care and the Afghanistan war, and a keen sense of what its like to work in his White House, day by day.

title: Dean Baker on Bernanke's Renomination
description: Economist Dean Baker on the renomination of Federal Reserve Chairman Ben S. Bernanke.

title: Dean Baker on TARP
description: Economist Dean Baker on the Fed's actions to support the Troubled Asset Relief Program.

title: Senate Gets a Climate and Energy Bill, Modified by a Gulf Spill That Still Grows
description: WASHINGTON  The long delayed and much amended Senate plan to deal with global warming and energy was unveiled on Wednesday to considerable fanfare but uncertain prospects.

title: Republicans Pick Tampa for 2012 Convention
description: Republicans selected Tampa, Fla., on Wednesday as the site of their 2012 presidential nominating convention, party officials said, with the Gulf Coast city triumphing over Salt Lake City and Phoenix.

title: Nascar Hall of Fame Museum Opens
description: The $195 million Nascar Hall of Fame opened Tuesday with considerable fanfare in Charlotte, N.C., the de facto capital of stock-car racing, and thousands showed up in the rain to salute a sport that has a colorful history, but a much sketchier future.

title: Good Effort Is Followed by Great One
description: DETROIT  Jorge Posada noticed a difference in Javier Vazquez from his very first pitch Wednesday. After getting ahead of Austin Jackson, the leadoff hitter for the Detroit Tigers, Vazquez grabbed the ball and went directly to the pitching rubber. He wanted to dictate the tempo. He wanted to control the game.

title: Films at Cannes
description: A look at some of the films screening at the 2010 Cannes International Film Festival.

title: New Type of Heart Defibrillator
description: The new device, which uses a sensing wire that can conduct a life-saving jolt, is implanted under the skin rather than threaded through a blood vessel and implanted inside the heart.

title: 36 Hours in Kansas City, Mo.
description: KANSAS CITY is known for its barbecue, bebop and easy-does-it Midwestern charm. But a decade-long effort to revitalize the citys downtown has transformed this former jazz mecca, which straddles the Kansas-Missouri border, back into a culturally rich metropolis. The citys standing will be further bolstered next year when the much-anticipated Kauffman Center for the Performing Arts opens, giving a sleek new home to the symphony, opera and ballet. True, Kansas City is no backwater, but dont expect high polish. In fact, its the citys unvarnished grit that may be its best asset.

title: The Mighty Colorado at a Glide
description: THERE we sat, five paddlers in three canoes on the Colorado River in northern Arizona, simply observing. The setting sun washed the 1,500-foot canyon walls in hues of coral; cotton-puff clouds dotted the pink-tinged sky. The still surface of the river so perfectly mirrored the cliffs and sky that it was hard, at a glance, to know where the river ended and the cliffs began. Except for a few ducks dallying on the shoreline, we were alone.

title: Letter: Memories of Burundi
description: To the Editor: Christopher Vourliass report on Burundis Freewheeling Nights (May 2) brought back memories of Bujumbura in the mid-1980s. The countrys last genocide lay 12 years in the past, and the next great bloodletting wouldnt happen for another decade. AIDS still lurked quietly below the surface, not quite ready to take its toll on Burundis population. In those fin dpoque days, patrons packed clubs like Africa Nights or the Black & White run by Buddy, a portly and far more congenial version of Casablancas Rick. Like some doomed Victorian heroine, Bujumburas attraction has always been its combination of the tragic and the tempting.

title: Where Wetsuits and Art Meet in Maui
description: IT was just after 10 a.m. and the Paia Contemporary Gallery was getting ready to open. The sun was streaming through the glass storefront, giving everything inside a warm glow. Alejandro Goya, the gallerys owner, was adjusting a small glass sculpture just a fraction of an angle.

title: Hunting and Gathering: Finding Evidence About Neanderthals
description: Overview | In this lesson, students reflect on what they know about Neanderthal Man. Then, in light of new genetic findings, they investigate how and what we know about Neanderthals by searching online for archaeological, structural and genetic evidence about our ancient relatives. They then reflect on what the information in Neanderthal DNA tells us about ourselves, and what it means to be human. Finally, they conduct additional research for further consideration of our ancient relatives.

title: Hotel Review: JW Marriott in Los Angeles
description: THE BASICS

title: Dallas Gets Its Groove Back
description: THERES a sun-baked, low-rise neighborhood in Dallas where urban pioneers have staked out a bling-free zone, set against the glittering backdrop of downtown skyscrapers. Deep Ellum  thats Texas-ese for Deep Elm, the neighborhoods original name  has historically been a scruffy working-class area.

title: Obama Aide Sees Higher Taxes for Carried Interest
description: Peter R. Orszag, the White House budget director, said Wednesday that he expected Congress to change the tax treatment of carried interest income at investment firms and that the impact of higher tax bills would not be as dire for Wall Street as some have suggested.

title: Letter: Luberon, Lost and Found
description: To the Editor: I greatly enjoyed Laurie Winers Happily Lost in the Luberon (May 2). About eight years ago my wife and I were on an Overseas Adventure Travel trip to Provence and one of our activities was a half-day hike into the Luberon National Park. Two fellow travelers were unable to make the hike, so our tour leader stayed behind and gave us instructions. About an hour into the hike it became painfully clear that we had strayed from the trail and were unhappily lost in the Luberon. At about that time we heard the ringing of a bell and soon saw a small beagle arrive that had been sent by the park superintendent to find us and lead us back. The beagle did an admirable job and reunited us with our tearful but relieved tour leader.

title: Restaurant Review: Gather, in Berkeley, Calif.
description: Ari Derfel and Eric Fenster were not yet born in 1971 when Alice Waters opened the seminal Chez Panisse, paving the road that brought local, seasonal cooking into the mainstream. But with Gather, their 148-seat restaurant, these self-described pathological optimists are turning that road into something of a four-lane highway.

title: Getting Close to the Last Liftoff
description: THE crowd, all facing the same direction, waits nervously. Some fiddle with cameras on tripods while others sit in camp chairs, slapping at mosquitoes and checking their cellphones for updates. A voice comes over a loudspeaker: T minus 9 minutes and counting. After hours of excruciating anticipation, the final checks for the space shuttle launching have been made and all systems are go.

title: A Quick Stop in Old Cuba
description: FOR most Americans, Havana remains  as a Cuban tourism official recently quipped to a reporter  the forbidden city, subject to a United States travel ban and enticingly off-limits. A steady trickle of American visitors continues to slip into the city via flights from Cancn and Nassau, quietly testing the Obama administrations de facto dont ask, dont tell Cuban travel policy at overseas customs desks. But why risk a steep fine when you can instead wing on down to Miami for next weekends 12th annual Cuba Nostalgia fair at the Miami-Dade County Fair Expo Center? Organizers expect a crowd of 30,000 for three days of Cuban art, music, food and, not least, shopping.

title: Auto Dealers Take On Obama
description: The National Automobile Dealers Association is going toe-to-toe with President Obama.

title: The Inevitable Brown Resignation Mashup
description: Two weeks after the low point of Gordon Browns election campaign  when a Sky News microphone on his lapel caught him grumbling to an aide about a bigoted woman he had just tried to charm  Chortle.co.uk, a comedy site, posted this video remix of his departure from Buckingham Palace on Tuesday, after he tendered his resignation to Queen Elizabeth II:

title: Houlihan, Reporting for Duty
description: ITS probably not surprising that Frank Doroff knows what is selling at any second at Bloomingdales since he is the stores vice chairman for ready-to-wear and bloomingdales.com. Still, on a recent evening with friends he was impressively prepared when someone mentioned that she had just bought a pair of cargo pants.

title: Questions for Clarence Seedorf: End of the Season Edition
description: With the European club season drawing to a close, the soccer world is turning its focus to the World Cup in South Africa.

title: City Council Upholds Landmark Status of West Side Church
description: The New York City Council on Wednesday upheld the landmark designation of West Park Presbyterian Church at Amsterdam Avenue and 86th Street, rewarding preservationists for their 20-year effort to save the Romanesque Revival building. The ruling disappointed the church leadership, which wanted to develop part of the site, a plan that involved tearing down part of the building.

title: Traveling Light | Isaac Reina Edition de Sacs
description: Perhaps attending architecture school should be a prerequisite for starting ones own line of accessories; apprenticeships at Herms and Martin Margiela wouldnt hurt either. Isaac Reinas bags alone make a (covetable) case for such rules.

title: What Were Reading: Underwater, Everywhere
E-Reader Applications for Today, and Beyond
description: Its no longer such a novel thing to read a book on a mobile phone, and on the iPad, its practically a requirement to download The Elements or open Winnie the Pooh to give your friends a glimpse of the future of book reading.

title: Pictures of the Day: 10 Downing Street and Elsewhere
description: The symbolic importance of 10 Downing Street was underscored as the government changed in official and not-so-official ways.

title: I.B.M.s Future: The Same, Only More So
description: Big Blue laid out its Roadmap to 2015 today at its yearly investors gathering, and Wall Street applauded.

title: SAP to Buy Sybase for $5.25 Billion
description: 5:49 p.m. | Updated Ashlee Vance has more in The New York Times.

title: Prepare Yourself for the World Cup
description: Dan Gaspar is the mens coach at the University of Hartford, and president of Connecticut Soccer School and Star Goalkeeper Academy. He is on the coaching staff of Portugals national team and will be contributing to the Goal blog in the run-up to and during the World Cup in South Africa.

title: Yankee Stadium, 12:28 P.M.
description: Soggy New York University students gave themselves a big cheer during a rain-spattered graduation ceremony Wednesday.

title: Bending Melodies Into Unorthodox Shapes
description: Heading into her encore at Dizzys Club Coca-Cola on Tuesday night, Nnenna Freelon gave her audience the illusion of a choice. Are you guys feeling frisky or sentimental? she asked. Frisky, came the reply. Well, all right, then: the band struck up a light-funk groove, and Ms. Freelon plunged into one last song, parsing lyrics with syncopation. Dreeeaam, she sang, beside me. In-the-mid-night-glow. The lamp. Is low.

title: Is There Life After Facebook?
description: Deanna Zandt has spent the last three years explaining to people why they should join Facebook and the last week wrestling with the urge to delete her own account.

title: Cisco Sales Rise, Beating Estimates
description: Cisco Systems, the maker of networking equipment, on Wednesday reported third-quarter profit that topped analysts estimates. The results were helped by orders from corporate customers that had surging video and Internet traffic.

title: Is Your Cat Normal?
description: Does your cat eat wool, meow a lot or have a passion for toilet water?

title: With Cushing, This Time the Stigma May Stick
description: Have we ever seen an N.F.L. player criticized this much for a positive performance-enhancing drug test?

title: Leonas Tip Policy May Be Illegal
description: Nearly three years after her death, Leonas legacy may be running afoul of New York City law.

title: Dose of Nostalgia for What Never Was
description: Any Place I Hang My Hat Is Home isnt just the title of the easygoing standard by Harold Arlen and Johnny Mercer that describes the vagabond life of a happy-go-lucky drifter. It could be the theme song of Johnny Rodgers, a bandleader, singer-songwriter, pianist and traditional jazzman, who suggests the tow-headed boy next door striding down a country road as he travels from one style to another.

title: Oscar Winners Back Filmmaker in Dispute With Chevron
description: The International Documentary Association and a group of filmmakers that includes 20 Academy Award winners and many more nominees have issued an open letter in support of Joe Berlinger, the director of Crude, and objecting to a judges ruling that Chevron could subpoena Mr. Berlingers footage from that film.

title: The Calvin Klein Underwear Model
description: Eric Wilson discusses the latest Calvin Klein underwear campaign and the history of the Calvin Klein underwear model.

title: U.S. Clears a Test of Bioengineered Trees
description: Federal regulators gave clearance Wednesday for a large and controversial field test of genetically engineered trees planned for seven states stretching from Florida to Texas.

title: Art in Heaven, Bless Be Thy Name
description: It is neither the business nor the aim of fashion to accommodate the mortal realm, the sinning, drooping, sagging world of the 9 to 5, the Double Down and Spanx. You show me a woman who can pull of Givenchys antimacassar-like black gowns and Ill show you an apparition, and probably an uncomfortable one at that. High fashion is like Elizabeth Barrett-Browning, too delicate and sensitive a constitution for wrinkles and Coke Zero, of means and averages. And this is how it should be, for in fashion, imagination trumps gravity and fancy utility. These long-legged beasts from Chanels silver ZiggystarDusty Springfields to Gallianos Ninotchka nomads do not belong to this world; They are instead ambassadors from the minds of Messrs Galliano, Tisci and Lagerfeld. Klaatu barada nikto!

title: Saban Reacquires Power Rangers, Moves Show to Nickelodeon
description: The media investor Haim Saban said Wednesday that he had bought back the rights to his biggest franchise, Power Rangers, from The Walt Disney Company, and had licensed the show to Nickelodeon, the childrens cable channel owned by Viacom.

title: In Revote, Cushing Keeps Award
description: Brian Cushing won the N.F.L.s defensive rookie of the year award in January. Last week it was learned that Cushing, a linebacker for the Houston Texans, tested positive for a performance-enhancing drug in September. And on Wednesday voters gave the award to Cushing anyway.

title: Cooking Tools: Digital Meal Planning
description: The idea at the heart of E-Mealz is incredibly simple: Each week, when grocery stores publish their weekly sale items, an email arrives in subscribers mailboxes with a list of dinners to prepare for the week, recipes whose ingredients are tied directly to specific store chains.

title: Sonata and Nanosonata in Varying Velocities
description: The British pianist Nicolas Hodges is best known as an astute interpreter of contemporary works, no doubt because his discography is weighted heavily toward new music. But his program biography points out that as a teacher  he is a professor at the Staatliche Hochschule fr Musik und Darstellende Kunst, in Stuttgart, Germany  he encourages his students to avoid specializing in either new music or the standard repertory.

title: Reyes Struggles While Rookie Puts Away Mets
description: In the Washington Nationals clubhouse at Citi Field, Roger Bernadina spoke softly while sitting next to a stereo blaring rap music.

title: Arriving at Monacos Work-in-Progress
description: MONACO  Arriving in Monaco today by bus from the Nice airport I felt that not only was the city a little bit of a work in progress before the first practice sessions tomorrow  of course, the track is ready  but also the paddock itself.

title: Ad: Calvin Klein Commercial
description: Kellen Lutz is featured in Calvin Klein's most recent underwear commercial.

title: Find Out Where Your Income Ranks
description: A story on MainStreet.com (linked from the Yahoo home page this morning) points to something called The Global Rich List. The concept is simple. Enter your annual income and see how you rank against everyone else on earth.

title: Bankers Suit Says She Was Fired for Questioning Account
description: A former private banker at JPMorgan Chase & Company has sued the bank, claiming that she was fired after alerting superiors to possibly questionable dealings by a top client.

title: Flashback: A Broken-Up Band Reunites, Briefly
description: The Golden Palominos was a band name attached to most of the music overseen by the drummer Anton Fier from the beginning of the 1980s to the end of the 90s. To be any more specific involves a long list of personnel and a passing reference to almost every kind of pop music played in America during that time; its no wonder, really, that they didnt make a lasting dent in the culture. But enough New Yorkers remember the breadth of what the band once represented to pack two clubs for Golden Palominos shows over the past week, Friday night at Le Poisson Rouge and Tuesday night at the Living Room.

title: The Education of 2-Year-Old Horses
description: On Tuesday I wrote about the gate-schooling process for babies (2-year-olds.) The post was inspired by our work that day at Fair Hill; we had three sets of babies gate-schooling.

title: Dressed Up for His Bomb Squad Audition
description: Perhaps the most memorable image from the Times Square car-bomb attempt was those men in the bulky green suits who walked right up to the smoking, sparking Pathfinder on West 45th Street and peered into it to find an elaborate assemblage of explosives.

title: Celebrating Mexico With Works of Its Own
description: Alondra de la Parra, the young Mexican-born founder and music director of the Philharmonic Orchestra of the Americas, spent more than a year researching little-known scores by Mexican composers to perform for the Mexican bicentennial. But there were no identifying national characteristics in many of the works that received their United States premieres at Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday evening, when Ms. de la Parra led the ensemble in a sold-out event, Mi Alma Mexicana.

title: Now Booking | Cannes Gastronomique
description: Even if youre not part of the set that is about to jet off to Cannes to sit in the dark for 10 days  the 63rd Cannes Film Festival runs from May 13 to 23  the palmy resort town unfailingly fascinates with some of Europes best beauty-and-the-beast people-watching.

title: That Film May Be Trash, but You Can Still Recycle It
description: Suppose your introduction to show business, at the tender age of 10 ,was a starring role in a low-budget horror movie that, for a time, was deemed by the users of the Internet Movie Database to be the worst movie ever. Some people might handle that embarrassment by omitting the credit from their rsum and hoping it never was discovered; others might be shamed out of the industry altogether. But one man made a film about this experience to share it with as many people as possible.

title: Abortion Rights Group Backs Sestak
description: Naral Pro-Choice America waded into Pennsylvanias Democratic primary for Senate on Wednesday, as its political action committee endorsed Representative Joe Sestaks bid to unseat incumbent Arlen Specter.

title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Furlough of State Workers
description: ALBANY  A federal judge on Wednesday temporarily blocked a one-day furlough of state workers scheduled by Gov. David A. Paterson for next week, reversing a plan that Mr. Paterson has said is necessary to keep the state from running out of money at the end of the month.

title: The Intersection of Fantasy and Faith
description: Some roles can really get under an actors skin. Playing Hamlet would surely put you in an existential mood. Macbeth could bring out a guys paranoid streak, even without that fabled curse said to attend productions. But playing the son of God has got to be the trickiest assignment of all. Hanging up there on the cross every night  twice on matinee days!  could give a guy a serious persecution complex, no?

title: On Dance: Movement to the Sound of Light
description: In the collaborative piece Necessary Weather, light, not music, serves as the score. Created between 1992 and 1994 by the respected lighting designer Jennifer Tipton and the dancer-choreographers Dana Reitz and Sara Rudner, the piece instantly became a seminal work that was hailed by critics for its interplay between light and dance.

title: Day After Chess Championship, Victor and Vanquished Reflect on the Match
description: One day after their title match in Sofia, Bulgaria, ended, Viswanathan Anand, the once and still champion, and Veselin Topalov were tired, but proud.

title: Turkeys Pact With Russia Will Give It Nuclear Plant
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey and Russia signed 17 agreements on Wednesday to enhance cooperation in energy and other fields, including pacts to build Turkeys first nuclear power plant and furthering plans for an oil pipeline from the Black Sea to the Mediterranean.

title: At the Met, Portraits of Grief, Written in Stone
description: They are so cute, these 16-inch-tall fellows in their floppy robes. Shuffling two by two, 36 strong, behind a choirboy on a black runway in the Metropolitan Museum of Arts cavernous Medieval Hall, theyre like a troop of fairy-tale dwarfs turned to stone by an evil sorcerer. Unhappy campers, they weep, sigh, gesture sadly and pray, mourning the demise of their liege, John the Fearless, Duke of Burgundy (1371-1419).

title: Amendments Target Credit Card Industry
description: As the Senate powers through dozens of proposed changes to the Democrats financial regulatory legislation, lawmakers have proposed at least three amendments designed to protect consumers and businesses from high credit card interest rates and fees.

title: When Parents Remarry (Each Other)
description: Ross Kenneth Urken is going to a wedding next week. His parents. There arent many etiquette books that cover this one. And the bride and groom arent the only ones whose history is being rewritten with remarriage.

title: You Never Know Where Her Gallery Will Pop Up Next
description: WHEN the downtown gallery owner Amy Smith-Stewart gave Kate Gilmore a solo show two years ago, the artist paid her back by leaving the space in apparent ruins. Ms. Gilmore had divided the gallery with walls, then ripped giant holes through them, creating jagged portals for visitors to enter the exhibition. Inside, a video loop showed the artist struggling to claw and kick her way out of similar walls.

title: Mapping Birds Without Boundaries
description: A new survey has found that 148 landbird species in North America are facing rapid decline, the majority of them in Mexico.

title: Office 2010: A Tale of Decadence and Hand-to-Hand Combat
description: Arriving at Googles main campus the other day, I flipped my keys to the valet and hopped out of my car. I noticed a modified RV over on the right side of the parking lot where employees could get quick, free hair cuts.

title: Slide Show: Playing at Cannes
description: More Photographs

title: Pope, Praying for Priests, Visits Shrine
description: FATIMA, Portugal  A day after acknowledging the churchs responsibility for the sexual abuse crisis, Pope Benedict XVI on Wednesday traveled to this popular pilgrim shrine and prayed for priests not to fall short of their sublime vocation or succumb to the temptations of the evil one.

title: Elder Statesmans New Story
description: THAT the director Monte Hellman is at the Cannes Film Festival isnt really a news flash. As the elder statesman of the idiosyncratic, independent and overlooked American filmmakers that the French treasure, Mr. Hellman  best known for 1971s Two-Lane Blacktop  has long been a fixture at this annual gathering along the Mediterranean. But this year Mr. Hellman comes to Cannes with something he has rarely brought with him on his previous trips: a movie to sell. Mr. Hellmans influence may be widespread, but his Hollywood career has been in a state of perpetually arrested development.

title: The Greece Analogy
description: Neal Conan at Talk of the Nation, the public-radio show, just asked me about todays New York Times debate over the deficit. I compared Greeces fiscal problems to the long-term ones facing this country. Paul Krugman thinks the comparison is overblown.

title: Travel Deals: Northeast Getaway with Lobster Dinner
description: Some hotels offer spa credits. Others offer room upgrades. This summer, four northeast resorts are offering a different sort of incentive: waterfront accommodations and a lobster dinner for two, starting at $179 a night.

title: They Stalk the Banded Mink
description: HUNG from the doorknob of a modest brick house in Flushing, Queens, is a laminated government flier advising the homeowner, Its not too late to mail back your census form!

title: Sale Veterans
description: A couple who have a regular booth at Brooklyn Flea have mastered the art of collecting and selling.

title: Growers Feel the Squeeze to Sell a Pinch of Saffron
description: NAVELLI, Italy  The families in this medieval town are so devoted to saffron, the precious spice they painstakingly cultivate and process by hand, that they stash the dried flower stigmas it comes from in the safest, driest place in the house: the matriarchs wardrobe.
